hints.content: First, we need to find $2\dfrac14$ and $4\dfrac34$ feet on the number line.

$2\dfrac14$ is after $2$ but before $3$.

[[☃ image 1]]

There are $4$ equal parts, or fourths, between each whole. We can use equivalent fractions to label each tick.

[[☃ image 2]]

options.alt: A line plot that has, moving left to right, labeled tick marks at 2 and 3. Between the labeled tick marks are three equally-spaced unlabeled tick marks. !

A line plot that has, moving left to right, labeled tick marks at 2, 2 and one-fourth, 2 and one-half, 2 and three-fourths, and 3. The 2 and one-fourth tick mark is marked with a vertical dotted line. !

hints.content:
$4\dfrac34$ is after $4$ but before $5$.

[[☃ image 1]]

There are $4$ equal parts, or fourths, between each whole. We can use equivalent fractions to label each tick.

[[☃ image 2]]

options.alt: A line plot that has, moving left to right, labeled tick marks at 4 and 5. Between the labeled tick marks are three equally-spaced unlabeled tick marks. !

A line plot that has, moving left to right, labeled tick marks at 4, 4 and one-fourth, 4 and one-half, 4 and three-fourths, and 5. The 4 and three-fourths tick mark is marked with a vertical dotted line. !

hints.content:
Each dot represents one frog jump. 

So, we need to count all of the dots on the line plot that are between  $2\dfrac14$  feet and $4\dfrac34$ feet.

[[☃ image 1]]

options.alt: A line plot labeled Frog jump lengths (feet) shows, moving left to right, labeled tick marks at 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, and 7. Three unlabeled tick marks appear between each labeled tick mark. Dots are plotted as follows: 1 dot above 2, 2 dots above the second unlabeled tick mark after 2, 2 dots above the first unlabeled tick mark after 3, 3 dots above the second unlabeled tick mark after 3, 1 dot above the third unlabeled tick mark after 3, 1 dot above the first unlabeled tick mark after 4, 3 dots above the second unlabeled tick mark after 4, 2 dots above 5, 2 dots above the second unlabeled tick mark after 5, and 1 dot above the first unlabeled tick mark after 6. The first unlabeled tick mark after 2 is marked with a vertical dotted line. The third unlabeled tick mark after 4 is also marked with a vertical dotted line. The dots between these 2 vertical dotted lines (between 2 and 1 fourth feet and 4 and 3 fourths feet) are all highlighted. !

hints.content:
There are $\greenD{12}$ dots that are between $2\dfrac14$  feet and $4\dfrac34$ feet.

$\greenD{12}$ jumps were  between $2\dfrac14$  feet and $4\dfrac34$ feet.

question.content:
The jump lengths of some frogs are shown below.  

[[☃ image 1]]

**How many jumps are  between $2\dfrac14$  feet and $4\dfrac34$ feet?** 
 
[[☃ input-number 1]] jumps

options.alt: A line plot labeled Frog jump lengths (feet) shows, moving left to right, labeled tick marks at 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, and 7. Three unlabeled tick marks appear between each labeled tick mark. Dots are plotted as follows: 1 dot above 2, 2 dots above the second unlabeled tick mark after 2, 2 dots above the first unlabeled tick mark after 3, 3 dots above the second unlabeled tick mark after 3, 1 dot above the third unlabeled tick mark after 3, 1 dot above the first unlabeled tick mark after 4, 3 dots above the second unlabeled tick mark after 4, 2 dots above 5, 2 dots above the second unlabeled tick mark after 5, and 1 dot above the first unlabeled tick mark after 6 !
